title: Terrible Casting
review: The whole film is undermined by the casting of Actors who have never played golf before playing college level/ professional golf... that is before the predictable storyline; other than this its quite an easy watch as you are never drawn in enough to really care

title: The only reason I didn't turn it off was because I couldn't be bothered to reach for the remote.
review:
Some really wooden acting unfortunately makes this movie difficult to watch. All the characters are typical white middle American with a token black guy, the coach. Every line has been heard in another movie. The storyline is one we've all heard before - parent is dying, I have to win this event for him / her. Child prodigy overcomes guilt, wins tournament (is that really a spoiler?) and everyone can get on with their lives.

They do a lot of praying which unsurprisingly has no effect. They keep mentioning this guy called God but he's not in the credits.

It's the sort of film you'd play in an old folks home during a coffee morning because if you missed a bit it doesn't matter and there's no plot that needs explaining anyway.

title: If You Like Faith-Based Films
review:
This faith-based film can be uplifting with some humor mixed in amidst tragedy. But it is filled with stilted dialogue, platitudes, and a very formulaic and predictable storyline.

So if you like faith-based films--enjoy. But it's not my cup of tea.
